description: From Old French empostume, alteration of apostume (“apostume, large abscess”), from Latin apostema, from Ancient Greek ἀπόστεμα (apóstema, “separation of pus into an abscess”).

examples: Jason Phereus [was] utterly forsaken of all Physitians, by reason of an impostume he had in his breast […].

verbs.description: impostume (third-person singular simple present impostumes, present participle impostuming, simple past and past participle impostumed)
